DataElementConcept.preferredName: Re-excision Cutaneous Melanoma Surgical Pathology Specimen Other Re-excision
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: definition pending:A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.:A field of anatomical pathology in which living tissue is surgically removed for the purpose of diagnosis and treatment.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:definition pending

ObjectClass.preferredName: Re-excision Cutaneous Melanoma Surgical Pathology Specimen
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: definition pending:A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.:A field of anatomical pathology in which living tissue is surgically removed for the purpose of diagnosis and treatment.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.

A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.
A field of anatomical pathology in which tissue or cells removed from a living organism are macroscopically and microscopically reviewed for the purpose of disease diagnosis.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:definition pending

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.
